org.helm.notation.tools

Class NucleotideSequenceParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.helm.notation.tools.NucleotideSequenceParser

  • public class NucleotideSequenceParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods that handle nucleotide sequences

      • getNotation

        public static java.lang.String getNotation(java.lang.String sequence)
                                    throws NotationException,
                                           java.io.IOException,
                                           org.jdom.JDOMException
        Assume sequence input in one of the following format
      • 5'-AGCUdT-3'
      • 3'-dTUCGA-5'
      • AFCUdT (default 5' to 3')
Parameters:
sequence - RNA nucleotide sequence 5' to 3'
Returns:
notation
Throws:
NotationException
java.io.IOException

                                           throws NotationException,
                                                  java.io.IOException,
                                                  org.jdom.JDOMException
    This method returns the sequence in reverse direction from the input sequence, ie. AAGCU => UCGAA
    Parameters:
    sequence - - input nucleotide sequence
    Returns:
    sequence in opposite direction (from right to left)
    Throws:
    NotationException
    java.io.IOException

  • isInOppositeDirection

    public static boolean isInOppositeDirection(java.lang.String senseSeq,
                            java.lang.String antiSenseSeq)
                                     throws NotationException,
                                            java.io.IOException,
                                            org.jdom.JDOMException
    Parameters:
    senseSeq - - siRNA sense strand sequence, generally in 5-3 direction
    antiSenseSeq - - siRNA antisense strand sequence, could be in 5-3 (same direction) or 3-5 (opposition direction)
    Returns:
    true if opposite, false is same
    Throws:
    NotationException
    java.io.IOException
    org.jdom.JDOMException

                                   java.lang.String seq2)
                                            throws NotationException
    Throws:
    NotationException

  • getMaxMatchFragment

    public static java.lang.String getMaxMatchFragment(java.lang.String seq1,
                                   java.lang.String seq2,
                                   int minLength)
                                            throws NotationException
    This method returns the largest matched fragment between two sequences, replace T with U before match
    Parameters:
    seq1 - single letter, all upper case nucleotide sequence
    seq2 - single letter, all upper case nucleotide sequence
    minLength - - minimum fragment length
    Returns:
    largest match fragment
    Throws:
    NotationException
